properties.headline: Lakeshore Flood Advisory issued January 18 at 10:56AM EST until January 18 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Minor lakeshore flooding expected.

* WHERE...Huron and Sanilac Counties.

* WHEN...Through 4 PM EST today.

* IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property along the
lakeshore.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southeast wind will increase during the
morning. This brings high waves closer to the Lake Huron shoreline
leading to intensified lakeshore flooding during the day. Winds
will then shift to westerly tonight allowing the lakeshore
flooding threat to subside, although additional minor lakeshore
flooding will be possible along the far northern shore of Huron
county.
properties.instruction:
Residents on or near the shore should take appropriate action to
protect property from rising water levels.

To learn more about dangerous waves and currents please visit
dangerouscurrents.org

NWSheadline: LAKESHORE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON
